intro: Torrubia myrtiflora, commonly known as the myrtleleaf torrubia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
